name: Changing the first three elements of an array
instruction:
Write a function `addLetter` that takes one parameter, an array.

The array contains 4 elements. 

The first 3 are strings. 

The fourth element is a nested array with three rows.

The nested array is at the end of the array.

Each line of the main and nested array contains one letter.

An example of a given array:
`['a', 'b', 'c', ['a', 'b', 'c']]`

Connect the first element of the array with the first element of the nested array in upper case.

Connect the second element of the array to the second element of the nested array in upper case.

Connect the third element of the array to the third element of the nested array in uppercase.

The function should return the modified array.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
addLetter(['a', 'd', 'g', ['j', 'm', 'p']]) // ['aJ', 'dM', 'gP', ['j', 'm', 'p']]
```
